info.title: Mycelium API
info.description:
# Mycelium API Gateway

**Mycelium** is a powerful **API Gateway** designed to provide secure and
flexible management of API services. It combines advanced authentication
mechanisms with robust resource and access control, making it the ideal solution
for organizations managing multiple clients and services.

---

## üöÄ Key Features

### üåê **API Gateway with Multi-Tenant Support**

- Mycelium functions as a central **API Gateway**, streamlining the management
  of API requests and responses.
- It supports **tenants**, which are namespaces that separate resources for
  different user groups. This feature is crucial for businesses offering APIs to
  multiple clients, ensuring resource isolation and secure operations.

### üîê **Comprehensive Authentication Options**

Mycelium provides a variety of authentication methods to suit different
scenarios:

- **Native Authentication**: Standard username and password login for end users
  with TOTP support.
- **OAuth2 Integration**: Authentication using Azure and Google accounts for
  seamless third-party integration.
- **Connection String Authentication**: Token-based authentication for
  service-to-service communication, with tokens generated securely by Mycelium.

### üõ°Ô∏è **Role Management System**

- Mycelium includes a full-featured **role management system**, allowing users
  to create and manage hierarchical roles.
- This system enables flexible role definitions, ensuring that access levels
  align with specific organizational requirements.

### üéõÔ∏è **Permission Management System**

- Mycelium provides granular **permission management**, letting users define
  specific access rights for various resources.
- This ensures fine-grained control over who can view, modify, or manage APIs
  and related resources.

### ü™™ **Detailed Access Control**

- Downstream APIs can receive user profile information from Mycelium, allowing
  them to customize responses based on the user's role and permissions.

### **Endpoints protection by role**

- Downstream APIs can be protected by role and specific permissions, ensuring
  that only users with the appropriate access level can interact with them.
- The filtration process is performed at the gateway level, preventing
  unauthorized access to downstream services.

---

By combining the capabilities of an API Gateway with advanced authentication,
multi-tenant support, and detailed access control systems, Mycelium empowers
organizations to securely manage their APIs and scale efficiently across diverse
client needs.

## üõ°Ô∏è Mycelium roles

Mycelium works with a set of predefined roles that can be assigned to users.
Predefined roles ensures a consistent and secure access control across the
organization. Standard roles include full application access roles (super user
[SU] and not super user roles), as well as roles with limited access to specific
tenants or resources.

### **Super User (SU) Roles**

Super users has the ability to scale up and down user and permissions and
perform application level operations. Super users inherits abilities from all
other roles.

- **Staff's**: Has the exclusive ability to upgrade and downgrade new users to
  the manager's and staff's roles.

- **Manager's**: Has the exclusive ability to manage tenants and their
  resources.

### **Application Level Roles (not SU)**

- TODO

### **Tenant Level Roles**

- TODO

### **Account Level Roles**

- TODO

### **Beginners**

- TODO

### **Service**

- TODO

---

post.summary: Guest a user to work on account.
post.description:
This action gives the ability of the target account (specified through
the `account` argument) to perform actions specified in the `role`
path argument.

get.description: Get the details of the account associated with the current user.

post.description: A user related account is an account that is created for a physical person.

delete.description: Delete the account associated with the current user.

patch.description: Update the account name of the account owner.

post.description:
This action creates a connection string that is associated with the user
account. The connection string has the same permissions of the user account.

This route should be used to register a new user. If the Bearer token is
included in the request, the user will be registered with the provider
informed in the token. Otherwise, the password is required.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An optional Bearer token. When included, the user will be registered with the provider informed in the token.

post.description:
This route should be used to login with email and password. If the user has
enabled the TOTP app, the user will be redirected to the TOTP activation
route.
This route should be used to check the token and reset the password.
This route should be used to start the password redefinition process.

get.description: This endpoint is deprecated. Please use the /status endpoint instead.

410.description: This endpoint is deprecated. Please use the /status endpoint instead.

post.description:
This route should be used to check the TOTP token when tht totp app is
enabled.
This route should be used to disable the TOTP app.

This route should be used to enable the TOTP app. Before enabling the TOTP
the user must be authenticated using the `/login/` route.
This route should be used to validate the TOTP app after enabling it.
This route should be used to check the token and activate the user.

patch.description:
Any account could be activated and deactivated. This action turn an
account active.

New accounts should be approved after has permissions to perform
operation on the system. These endpoint should approve such account.

Any account could be activated and deactivated. This action turn an
account deactivated.

Also approved account should be disapproved at any time. These endpoint
work for this.

post.description:
System roles should be used to attribute permissions to actors who manage
specific parts of the system. This function creates the following roles:

- Subscriptions Manager
- Users Manager
- Account Manager
- Guest Manager
- Gateway Manager
- System Manager
- Tenant Manager

delete.description:
A single tenant can have multiple owners. This endpoint allows to exclude an
owner from the tenant.

patch.description:
A single tenant can have multiple owners. This endpoint allows to include a
new owner to the tenant.
Decrease permissions of the refereed account.
Increase permissions of the refereed account.

slug.description:
The Account Slug

This is generated from the account name. This is used for programmatic
access and verification of the account.

tags.description:
Account Tags

Information about the account. This is used for categorizing and filter
account.

isActive.description:
Account is active

If the account is active. This is used for logic trash and restore
account.

isChecked.description:
Account is checked

If the account was verified by a human. This is used for account
verification.

isArchived.description:
Account is archived

If the account is archived. This is used for account archiving.

isDeleted.description:
Account is deleted

If the account is deleted. This is used for logic trash and restore
account.

oneOf.description:
Verbose status

Is the human readable status of the account.

owners.description:
The Account Owners

This is the list of account owners. The account owners are the users who
have the account owner role.

accountType.description:
The Account Type

Account type is the type of the account. The account type is used to
categorize the account.

oneOf.description:
The Account Guest Users

This is the list of guest users of the account.

The Account Created By

The ID of the account that created the account. This is used for
auditing purposes.

The Account Updated By

The ID of the account that updated the account. This is used for
auditing purposes.

meta.description:
The Account Meta

Store metadata about the account.

oneOf.description: Phone Number
The Telegram User
The WhatsApp User

To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

custom.description:
To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

oneOf.description:
Staff account type

Staff account type is a special account type that is used to represent
staff members in the system.

Manager account type

Manager account type is a special account type that is used to represent
managers in the system.

User account type

User account type is the default account type for users in the system.

Subscription account type

A subscription account is a special account type that is used to
represent legal entities that have a subscription to the service.

subscription.description:
Subscription account type

A subscription account is a special account type that is used to
represent legal entities that have a subscription to the service.

oneOf.description:
Role associated account type

Role associated account type is an special type of account, created to
connect users to a specific standard role in the application.

roleAssociated.description:
Role associated account type

Role associated account type is an special type of account, created to
connect users to a specific standard role in the application.

roleName.description:
The role name

The role name should be the same for the read and write roles.

readRoleId.description:
The read role ID

The read role ID is the ID of the role that will be used to read the
data from the account.

writeRoleId.description:
The write role ID

The write role ID is the ID of the role that will be used to write
the data to the account.

Children_Account_String.description:
A children record

This enumerator allow represents the children elements using their primary
keys (Ids option) or the true records (Record option).

created.description: The date and time the role was created

updated.description: The date and time the role was last updated

system.description:
If it is a system role

System roles represents standard core actors of the Mycelium API
Gateway, defined in `SystemActor`

oneOf.description:
Children roles represents guest roles that are children of the current
role, and should be used to determine the allowed roles for the role
owner guest other users.

Children_GuestRole_String.description:
A children record

This enumerator allow represents the children elements using their primary
keys (Ids option) or the true records (Record option).

email.description:
The guest user email

The email is used to identify the guest user connection with the target
account.

oneOf.description: The account which the guest user is connected to

wasVerified.description:
The guest user is verified

WHile the user is not verified, the user will not be able to access
the account.

Children_GuestUser_String.description:
A children record

This enumerator allow represents the children elements using their primary
keys (Ids option) or the true records (Record option).

email.description:
The owner email

The email of the user that administrate the profile. Email denotes the
central part of the profile management. Email should be used to collect
licensed IDs and perform guest operations. Thus, it should be unique in
the Mycelium platform.

isPrincipal.description: If the owner is the principal account owner

Children_Owner_String.description:
A children record

This enumerator allow represents the children elements using their primary
keys (Ids option) or the true records (Record option).

isPrincipal.description:
If the user is the principal user of the account.

The principal user contains information of the first email that created
the account. This information is used to send emails to the principal
user.

Principal users should not be deleted or deactivated if the account has
other users connected.

oneOf.description:
The user provider.

Provider is a optional field but it should be None only during the
collection of the user data from database. Such None initialization
prevents that password hashes and salts should be exposed to the
outside.

! Thus, be careful on change this field.

mfa.description:
The user TOTP

When enabled the user has verified the TOTP and the auth url is set.

Children_User_String.description:
A children record

This enumerator allow represents the children elements using their primary
keys (Ids option) or the true records (Record option).

expiration.description:
The expiration time of the token

The expiration time of the token in seconds.

tenantId.description:
A single tenant ID

If specified, the actions allowed by the token will be scoped to the
tenant. If not specified, the actions allowed by the token will be
scoped to the user profile.

role.description:
A single role

If specified, the actions allowed by the token will be scoped to the
role. If not specified, the actions allowed by the token will be
scoped to the user profile.

permissionedRoles.description:
The permissioned roles

If specified, the actions allowed by the token will be scoped to the
roles and permissions. Otherwise, the complete set of roles and
permissions present in the user profile will be used.

ErrorCode.description:
ErrorCode is a struct that represents an error code.

It is used to represent errors that occur in the system. Error should be
internal or external. Internal errors are errors that are not expected to
occur in the system. External errors are errors that are not expected to
occur in the system.

code.description: A compiled string of the prefix and code.

isInternal.description: Whether the error is internal or external.

isNative.description: Whether the error is native of mycelium or not.

created.description: The date and time the role was created

updated.description: The date and time the role was last updated

system.description:
If it is a system role

System roles represents standard core actors of the Mycelium API
Gateway, defined in `SystemActor`

oneOf.description:
Children roles represents guest roles that are children of the current
role, and should be used to determine the allowed roles for the role
owner guest other users.

email.description:
The guest user email

The email is used to identify the guest user connection with the target
account.

oneOf.description: The account which the guest user is connected to

wasVerified.description:
The guest user is verified

WHile the user is not verified, the user will not be able to access
the account.

email.description: The email of the guest user

parentRoleId.description:
The parent role id

The parent related to the guest role to be created. Example, if the
guest role is a child of the account manager role, the parent role id
should be this role id.

The child role id should be passed as the `role_id` path argument.

oneOf.description: Phone Number
The Telegram User
The WhatsApp User

To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

custom.description:
To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

oneOf.description: The health status is unknown
The health status is healthy

checkedAt.description: The timestamp for the last health check

oneOf.description: The health status is fully unhealthy

unhealthy.description: The health status is fully unhealthy

checkedAt.description: The timestamp for the last health check

attempts.description: The number of attempts with unhealthy status

checkedAt.description: The timestamp for the last health check

attempts.description: The number of attempts with unavailable status

HealthStatus.description:
The health status of the service

The status should be Unknown, Healthy or Unhealthy. At the startup of the
service, the status should be Unknown. When the health check is successful,
the status should be Healthy. When the health check is not successful, the
status should be Unhealthy.

oneOf.description:
Authentication header

The secret is passed as an authentication header.

authorizationHeader.description:
Authentication header

The secret is passed as an authentication header.

headerName.description:
The header name

The name of the header. For example, if the name is `Authorization`,
the header will be `Authorization Bear: <token value>`. The default
value is `Authorization`.

prefix.description:
The header prefix

If present the prefix is added to the header. For example, if the
prefix is `Bearer`, the header will be `Authorization Bearer: <token
value>`.

token.description:
The header token

The token is the value of the header. For example, if the token is
`1234`, the header will be `Authorization Bearer: 123

name.description:
The query parameter name

The name of the query parameter. For example, if the name is `token`,
the query parameter will be `?token=<token value>`.

token.description:
The query parameter value

The value of the query parameter. For example, if the value is `1234`,
the query parameter will be `?token=1234`.

accId.description:
The guest account unique id

This is the unique identifier of the account that is own of the
resource to be managed.

sysAcc.description:
If the guest account is a system account

System accounts has permissions to act as special users into the
Mycelium system.

tenantId.description:
The guest account tenant unique id

This is the unique identifier of the tenant that is own of the resource
to be managed.

accName.description:
The guest account name

This is the name of the account that is own of the resource to be
managed.

role.description:
The guest account role verbose name

This is the verbose name of the role that is own of the resource to be
managed.

perm.description:
The guest role permissions

This is the list of permissions that the guest role has.

verified.description:
If the guest account was verified

If the user accepted the invitation to join the account, the account
should be verified.

name.description: The name of the guest role.

slug.description: The slug of the guest role.

system.description: If it is a system role.

email.description: The email which the guest user is connected to

roles.description: The roles which the guest user was invited to

permissionedRoles.description: The permissioned roles which the guest user was invited to

description.description:
Description

The description of the service.

contexts.description:
The contexts

The contexts of the service. This key snould include the context where
the service should run, including authentication and authorization
information.

lastUpdated.description:
The last updated date

The last updated date of the service.

tools.description:
A list of tools

A list of tools that are discoverable by the service.

totp.description:
The TOTP

The TOTP is disabled by default.

email.description:
The owner email

The email of the user that administrate the profile. Email denotes the
central part of the profile management. Email should be used to collect
licensed IDs and perform guest operations. Thus, it should be unique in
the Mycelium platform.

isPrincipal.description: If the owner is the principal account owner

PaginatedRecord_GuestUser.description:
A default pagination response

A paginated record include the total number of records found into a query
plus page size which records will be retrieved, the number of records to be
ignored (such value should be discovered after the first query), and the
records itself.

The guest user email

account.

WHile the user is not verified, the user will not be able to access
the account.

This is generated from the account name. This is used for programmatic
access and verification of the account.

tags.description:
Account Tags

Information about the account. This is used for categorizing and filter
account.

If the account is active. This is used for logic trash and restore
account.

isChecked.description:

If the account was verified by a human. This is used for account
verification.

isArchived.description:

If the account is archived. This is used for account archiving.

isDeleted.description:
Account is deleted

If the account is deleted. This is used for logic trash and restore
account.

oneOf.description:
Verbose status

Is the human readable status of the account.

owners.description:
The Account Owners

This is the list of account owners. The account owners are the users who
have the account owner role.

accountType.description:
The Account Type

Account type is the type of the account. The account type is used to
categorize the account.

The Account Guest Users

This is the list of guest users of the account.

The Account Created By

The ID of the account that created the account. This is used for
auditing purposes.

The Account Updated By

The ID of the account that updated the account. This is used for
auditing purposes.

The Account Meta

Store metadata about the account.

The Telegram User
The WhatsApp User

Parent_Account_String.description:
A parent record

This enumerator allow represents the parent elements using their primary
key (Id option) or the true record (Record option).

created.description: The date and time the role was created

updated.description: The date and time the role was last updated

system.description:
If it is a system role

System roles represents standard core actors of the Mycelium API
Gateway, defined in `SystemActor`

oneOf.description:
Children roles represents guest roles that are children of the current
role, and should be used to determine the allowed roles for the role
owner guest other users.

Parent_GuestRole_String.description:
A parent record

This enumerator allow represents the parent elements using their primary
key (Id option) or the true record (Record option).

record.description:
The Upstream Service

The service is the upstream service that the route will proxy to.

id.description:
The service id

The id of the service. If the id is not provided, the service will be
generated using the name of the service.

name.description:
The service unique name

The name of the service. The name should be unique and is used to
identify the service and call it from the gateway url path.

host.description:
The service host

The host of the service. The host should include the port number. It
can be a single host or a vector of hosts.

protocol.description:
The service protocol

The protocol of the service.

routes.description:
The service routes

The routes of the service.

healthStatus.description: The health status of the service

healthCheckPath.description:
The service health check configuration

The health check configuration for the service.

discoverable.description:
The service discoverable

When true, the service will be discovered by LLM agents.

oneOf.description:
The service type

Optional together with discoverable field. The type of the service.

isContextApi.description:
If is a context api

If is a context api, the service will be discovered by LLM agents.

capabilities.description:
The service capabilities

Optional together with discoverable field. The capabilities of the
service.

description.description:
The service description

Optional together with discoverable field. The description of the
service. The description should be used during the service discovery by
LLM agents.

openapiPath.description:
The service openapi path

Optional together with discoverable field. The path to the openapi.json
file. The file should be used for external clients to discover the
service. Is is used for the service discovery by LLM agents.

secrets.description:
The service secrets

The secrets of the service. Secrets are used to authenticate the api
gateway at the downstream service. Individual routes can request a
specific secret of this secrets vector.

allowedSources.description:
The allowed sources

A list of sources with permissions to access the downstream service.
Values can be a domain name, ip address, a cidr block or a wildcard
domain name.

proxyAddress.description:
The proxy address

The proxy address of the service. This is used to forward requests to
the service through a proxy. If the service is not behind a proxy, this
field should be empty.

Example:

```yaml
proxyAddress: http://proxy.example.com:8080
```

Then, the downstream url should be:

```
http://proxy.example.com:8080/http://service.example.com:8080/api/v1/service/1234567890
```

Parent_Service_String.description:
A parent record

This enumerator allow represents the parent elements using their primary
key (Id option) or the true record (Record option).

Profile.description: This object should be used over the application layer operations.

accId.description:
The account unique id

Such ID is related to the account primary-key instead of the owner
primary key. In the case of the subscription accounts (accounts flagged
with `is_subscription`) such ID should be propagated along the
application flow.

isSubscription.description:
If profile belongs to a `subscription` account

Subscription accounts should be used to manage legal entities. Only
subscription accounts should receive guest accounts.

isManager.description:
If profile belongs to a `manager` account

Manager accounts should be used by users with elevated privileges inside
the Mycelium platform. Such user should perform actions like create
roles, guest-roles, guest default-user accounts to work into
subscription accounts.

isStaff.description:
If profile belongs to a `staff` account

Staff user has elevated roles into the application. Like managers, staff
users has elevated privileges. Only staff user has permission to
delegate other staffs.

ownerIsActive.description:
If the account owner is active

Profiles exists to abstract account privileges. If the profile is
related to an inactive owner the profile could not perform any action.
Only staff or manager user should perform the activation of such users.

accountIsActive.description:
If the account itself is inactive

When inactive accounts should not perform internal operations.

accountWasApproved.description:
If the account was approved after registration

New accounts should be approved by manager or staff users after their
registration into the Mycelium platform. Case the approval was
performed, this flag should be true.

accountWasArchived.description:
If the account was archived after registration

New accounts should be archived. After archived accounts should not be
included at default filtering actions.

accountWasDeleted.description:
If the account was deleted after registration

New accounts should be deleted. After deleted accounts should not be
included at default filtering actions.

oneOf.description:
Indicate the profile status for humans

The profile status is composed of all account flags statuses
composition. But it is not readable for humans. These struct attribute
allows human users to understand the account status without read the
flags, avoiding misinterpretation of this.

Accounts guested to the current profile

Guest accounts delivers information about the guest account role and
their respective permissions inside the host account. A single account
should be several licenses into the same account.

Tenants which the profile has ownership

This field should be used to store the tenants that the profile has
ownership. The ownership should be used to filter the licensed resources
during system validations.

filteringState.description:
This argument stores the licensed resources state

The licensed_resources_state should store the current filtering state.
The filtering state should be populated when a filtering cascade is
performed. As example:

If a profile with two licensed resources is filtered by the tenant_id
the state should store the tenant id used to filter licensed resources.

State formatting:

```json
[
   "1:tenantId:123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
]
```

And then, if the used apply a secondary filter, by permission, the state
should be updated to:

```json
[
  "1:tenantId:123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "2:permission:1",
]
```

If a consecutive filter with more one tenant is applied, the state
should be updated to:

```json
[
 "1:tenantId:123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
 "2:permission:1",
 "3:tenantId:123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001",
]
```

secretName.description: The route secret name if it exists

acceptInsecureRouting.description:
The route without tls

This field should be evaluated if the route should request a secret to
be send to the downstream service, if the route is not secure.

oneOf.description:
Retrieve the value from the environment variable

The value should be the name of the environment variable.

# Example

```bash
export MY_ENV_VAR="my_value"
```

```yaml
databaseUrl:
    env: "MY_ENV_VAR"
```

The value of `databaseUrl` will be `my_value`

env.description:
Retrieve the value from the environment variable

The value should be the name of the environment variable.

# Example

```bash
export MY_ENV_VAR="my_value"
```

```yaml
databaseUrl:
    env: "MY_ENV_VAR"
```

The value of `databaseUrl` will be `my_value`

oneOf.description:
Retrieve the value from the vault

The value should be the name of the vault secret.

# Example

```yaml
databaseUrl:
    vault:
        path: "my_vault_secret"
        key: "my_key"
```

The value of `databaseUrl` will be the value of the secret located at
`path/my_vault_secret` in the vault.

vault.description:
Retrieve the value from the vault

The value should be the name of the vault secret.

# Example

```yaml
databaseUrl:
    vault:
        path: "my_vault_secret"
        key: "my_key"
```

The value of `databaseUrl` will be the value of the secret located at
`path/my_vault_secret` in the vault.

oneOf.description:
Retrieve the value directly from a configuration file

The value should be the value itself.

# Example

```yaml
databaseUrl: "my_value"
```

Authentication header

The secret is passed as an authentication header.

authorizationHeader.description:
Authentication header

The secret is passed as an authentication header.

headerName.description:
The header name

The name of the header. For example, if the name is `Authorization`,
the header will be `Authorization Bear: <token value>`. The default
value is `Authorization`.

prefix.description:
The header prefix

If present the prefix is added to the header. For example, if the
prefix is `Bearer`, the header will be `Authorization Bearer: <token
value>`.

token.description:
The header token

The token is the value of the header. For example, if the token is
`1234`, the header will be `Authorization Bearer: 123

name.description:
The query parameter name

The name of the query parameter. For example, if the name is `token`,
the query parameter will be `?token=<token value>`.

token.description:
The query parameter value

The value of the query parameter. For example, if the value is `1234`,
the query parameter will be `?token=1234`.

SecretResolver_HttpSecret.description:
A secret resolver

The secret resolver is a way to resolve a secret value from different
sources.

oneOf.description: Allow public access to the route
Users should be only authenticated with a valid API token
Protect the route with the full user profile
Protect the route with the user profile filtered by roles

protectedByRoles.description: Protect the route with the user profile filtered by roles

oneOf.description:
Protect the route with the user profile filtered by roles and
permissions

protectedByPermissionedRoles.description:
Protect the route with the user profile filtered by roles and
permissions

oneOf.description: Protect the route with service token associated to a specific role list

protectedByServiceTokenWithRole.description: Protect the route with service token associated to a specific role list

oneOf.description:
Protect the route with service token associated to a specific role and
permissions

protectedByServiceTokenWithPermissionedR.description:
Protect the route with service token associated to a specific role and
permissions

Service.description:
The Upstream Service

The service is the upstream service that the route will proxy to.

id.description:
The service id

The id of the service. If the id is not provided, the service will be
generated using the name of the service.

name.description:
The service unique name

The name of the service. The name should be unique and is used to
identify the service and call it from the gateway url path.

host.description:
The service host

The host of the service. The host should include the port number. It
can be a single host or a vector of hosts.

protocol.description:
The service protocol

The protocol of the service.

routes.description:
The service routes

The routes of the service.

healthStatus.description: The health status of the service

healthCheckPath.description:
The service health check configuration

The health check configuration for the service.

discoverable.description:
The service discoverable

When true, the service will be discovered by LLM agents.

oneOf.description:
The service type

Optional together with discoverable field. The type of the service.

isContextApi.description:
If is a context api

If is a context api, the service will be discovered by LLM agents.

capabilities.description:
The service capabilities

Optional together with discoverable field. The capabilities of the
service.

description.description:
The service description

Optional together with discoverable field. The description of the
service. The description should be used during the service discovery by
LLM agents.

openapiPath.description:
The service openapi path

Optional together with discoverable field. The path to the openapi.json
file. The file should be used for external clients to discover the
service. Is is used for the service discovery by LLM agents.

secrets.description:
The service secrets

The secrets of the service. Secrets are used to authenticate the api
gateway at the downstream service. Individual routes can request a
specific secret of this secrets vector.

allowedSources.description:
The allowed sources

A list of sources with permissions to access the downstream service.
Values can be a domain name, ip address, a cidr block or a wildcard
domain name.

proxyAddress.description:
The proxy address

The proxy address of the service. This is used to forward requests to
the service through a proxy. If the service is not behind a proxy, this
field should be empty.

Example:

```yaml
proxyAddress: http://proxy.example.com:8080
```

Then, the downstream url should be:

```
http://proxy.example.com:8080/http://service.example.com:8080/api/v1/service/1234567890
```

oneOf.description:
The host of the service

The host should include the port number.

Example:

```yaml
host: localhost:8080
```

The hosts of the service

The hosts should include the port number.

Example:

```yaml
hosts:
  - localhost:8080
  - localhost:8081
```

Beginner

This actor is used when no role is assigned to the user.

Subscriptions manager

This actor is responsible for managing subscriptions accounts.

Users account manager

This actor is responsible for managing users accounts.

Account manager

This actor is responsible for managing a single subscription account.

Guest manager

This actor is responsible for managing roles, guest-roles, and
guest-users.

Gateway manager

This actor is responsible for managing gateway endpoints and related
configurations.

System manager

This actor is responsible for managing system, including error messages,
webhooks, and others.

Tenant owner

This actor is responsible for managing tenant metadata, tags, and owner.

WARNING: This is not a role in the system. Don't use to filter licensed
resource scopes during the profile checking.

‚ùå Wrong example:

```rust
let related_accounts = profile
    .on_tenant(tenant_id)
    .with_system_accounts_access()
    .with_write_access()
    .with_roles(vec![
        SystemActor::TenantOwner,
        SystemActor::TenantManager,
        SystemActor::SubscriptionsManager,
    ])
    .get_related_accounts_or_error()?;
```

This way should check if the profile has access to the tenant as a guest
role. However, tenant owner should be guest as a ownership not as a
licensed resource.

‚úÖ Right example:

```rust
let related_accounts = profile
    .on_tenant(tenant_id)
    .with_system_accounts_access()
    .with_write_access()
    .with_roles(vec![
        SystemActor::TenantManager,
        SystemActor::SubscriptionsManager,
    ])
    .get_related_accounts_or_tenant_or_error(tenant_id)?;
```

This way should check if the profile has ownership over the tenant.

Tenant manager

This actor is responsible for managing tenants.

Service

This is a service entity.

SystemActor.description:
The System Actors

Standard actors used to validate operations during the authorization process
in system use-cases.

id.description: The unique identifier of the tenant

owners.description:
The owner of the tenant

This is the email of the tenant owner, which is also the pub owner. The
tenant owner should be set on tenant creation.

oneOf.description:
The tenant manager

The account of the tenant manager.

tags.description:
The tags of the tenant

This is the list of tags of the tenant. The tags are used to categorize
the tenant. The tags are used to categorize the tenant.

meta.description:
Meta information

This is the meta information of the tenant. The meta information is a
key-value pair of string. The key is the name of the meta information,
and the value is the value of the meta information.

oneOf.description:
Federal Revenue Register

The Federal Revenue Register is the register of the federal revenue
of the tenant.

The type for the Federal Revenue Register

In Brazil, the FRR is CNPJ. In the US, the FRR is EIN.

The Country

The country of the tenant.

The State

The state of the tenant.

The Province

The province of the tenant.

The City

The city of the tenant.

The Address 1

The first address of the tenant.

The Address 2

The second address of the tenant.

The Zip Code

The zip code of the tenant.

To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

custom.description:
To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

status.description:
The status of the tenant

This is the status of the tenant. The status is a key-value pair of
string. The key is the name of the status (defined in `StatusKey`), and
the value is the value of the status.

created.description: The date and time the tenant was created

updated.description: The date and time the tenant was last updated

oneOf.description:
Federal Revenue Register

The Federal Revenue Register is the register of the federal revenue
of the tenant.

The type for the Federal Revenue Register

In Brazil, the FRR is CNPJ. In the US, the FRR is EIN.

The Country

The country of the tenant.

The State

The state of the tenant.

The Province

The province of the tenant.

The City

The city of the tenant.

The Address 1

The first address of the tenant.

The Address 2

The second address of the tenant.

The Zip Code

The zip code of the tenant.

To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

custom.description:
To specify any other meta key

Specify any other meta key that is not listed here.

tenant.description: The tenant ID that the profile has administration privileges

since.description: The date and time the tenant was granted to the profile

name.description:
The service unique name

The name of the service. The name should be unique and is used to
identify the service and call it from the gateway url path.

description.description:
The service description

Optional together with discoverable field. The description of the
service. The description should be used during the service discovery by
LLM agents.

toolType.description:
The service type

The type of the service.

isContextApi.description:
If is a context api

If is a context api, the service will be discovered by LLM agents.

capabilities.description:
The service capabilities

The capabilities of the service.

openapiPath.description:
The service openapi path

Optional together with discoverable field. The path to the openapi.json
file. The file should be used for external clients to discover the
service. Is is used for the service discovery by LLM agents.

healthStatus.description:
The service health status

The health status of the service.

oneOf.description:
The TOTP when enabled

The TOTP is enabled when the user has verified the TOTP and the auth
url is set. The secret is not serialized to avoid that the secret is
exposed to the outside.

enabled.description:
The TOTP when enabled

The TOTP is enabled when the user has verified the TOTP and the auth
url is set. The secret is not serialized to avoid that the secret is
exposed to the outside.

UnhealthyInstance.description:
The unhealthy instance

The unhealthy instance is a single instance of the service that is
unhealthy.

checkedAt.description: The timestamp for the last health check

isPrincipal.description:
If the user is the principal user of the account.

The principal user contains information of the first email that created
the account. This information is used to send emails to the principal
user.

Principal users should not be deleted or deactivated if the account has
other users connected.

oneOf.description:
The user provider.

Provider is a optional field but it should be None only during the
collection of the user data from database. Such None initialization
prevents that password hashes and salts should be exposed to the
outside.

! Thus, be careful on change this field.

mfa.description:
The user TOTP

When enabled the user has verified the TOTP and the auth url is set.

oneOf.description:
The webhook created by

The ID of the account that created the webhook. This is used for
auditing purposes.

The webhook updated by

The ID of the account that updated the webhook. This is used for
auditing purposes.

The webhook secret

Its important to note that the secret should be encrypted in the
database and redacted on the response.

id.description: The ID of the user who created the account

description.description:
Description

The description of the service.

contexts.description:
The contexts

The contexts of the service. This key snould include the context where
the service should run, including authentication and authorization
information.

lastUpdated.description:
The last updated date

The last updated date of the service.

tools.description:
A list of tools

A list of tools that are discoverable by the service.
